content: made to make this pattern error-free 2024kristina k miller intended for individual home use only not to be reproduced or reknit for profit row 5-8 are basically the same 4-row pattern as above with the exception that row 1 will now start with two cc sts decrease row 5 note that this row will start a color change *2 mc 2 cc* etc knit the first two cc sts together using mc resulting in one mc st on the right needle then continue in *2 cc 2 mc checkerboard pattern until two sts before next marker ssk two cc sts together with a mc yarn resulting in one mc st on right needle slip marker next knit first two mc sts together using cc resulting in one cc st on right needle then continue in *2 mc 2 cc* pattern until two sts before next marker ssk two mc sts together with a cc yarn resulting in one cc on right needle slip marker repeat this sequence twice more until you reach the bor you should have decreased 12 sts and now have 72 sts on your needles around each marker there should be 1 mc st and 1 cc st or 1 cc and 1 mc decrease row 6 knit the pattern with cc sts over cc and mc sts over mc the checkerboard pattern has been broken around the six markers with just one of each color on either side this will be corrected in the next row decrease row 7 note there is a color change on this row knit the first two mc/cc sts together with mc yarn resulting in one mc st next knit one mc st you now have two mc sts on the right needle then continue in *2 cc 2 mc checkerboard pattern until three sts before next marker knit one mc st and then ssk next two mc/cc sts with mc yarn now you have two mc st that pair together slip marker knit two cc/mc sts together with cc yarn resulting in 1 cc st knit next st with cc you now have 2 cc st on the right needle then proceed with *2 mc 2 cc* until 3 st before next marker knit one cc st ssk two cc/mc sts together cc yarn resulting in two cc sts on right needle slip marker repeat this sequence twice more until you reach the bor you should have decreased another 12 sts and now have 60 sts on your needles the checkerboard pattern has now been reset and alternates 2 mc sts and 2 cc sts decrease row 8 knit in checkerboard pattern with mc sts over mc and cc sts over cc repeat decrease row 1-6 switching to dpn when necessary until 24 sts remain with the mc yarn only k2tog all the way around resulting in 12 sts finishing cut mc and cc yarn leaving about a 12 tail of each thread mc tail onto yarn needle and slip
